title: Email field filtering problem.

activities.message: The same bug also exist on **https://app.mavenlink.com/settings/account/members** page.It occurs when we invite an user having 255+ character in email address.
activities.markdown_message: The same bug also exist on https://app.mavenlink.com/settings/account/members page.It occurs when we invite an user having 255+ character in email address.

activities.message:
Hi siddiki,

Thanks for the report. I just confirmed, and the email addresses are not being truncated in the database. The full address is stored. If they look truncated in the application, it's likely because the styling isn't configured for that long of an address. If you view the page source directly, you'll see the full address is there.

Thanks,
Nate

The full address is not there.I checked it.
And the email is not also being delivered as the address is wrong.
you can check my account associated with haxorsistz@gmail.com

I found from the page source:

<li class='email'>

https://app.mavenlink.com/api/v1/account_memberships?include=user%2Cdefault_role&only_active=false&per_page=20&page=1
You better have a look there for the email address.It is shown clearly that the email field is truncated.I believe you will reconsider the issue.

activities.message: I see, thanks for the details. I was testing locally which might have a different MySQL setup than production. We'll look into it some more.

activities.message: I think you didn't reward this issue as this was an application bug rather thn a security issue. Right? :)

activities.message: Yeah, unfortunately we're not able to award a bounty for it as there weren't security implications, but we've been able to give it Hall of Fame recognition.

vulnerability_information_html:
From the page: https://app.mavenlink.com/settings/email
When I tried to update the email address, I noticed that the database field was allocating 255 characters there.And if the input was more than 255 character that field was truncating.
For example:

haxorsistz+axorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxoailrsistzhaxoaaaaaaaa@gmail.com

This is a 265 character address.Though as per RFC the maximum length allowed for an email address is 255 characters.
But when I submitted that info,that was truncated and stored first 255 characters to the database.So the email address which was stored into database was:

haxorsistz+axorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxoailrsistzhaxoaaaaaaaa

Which is an invalid email address,without any @ and trailing domain name.

So,I suggest mavenlink to check the submitted character length and the validity of that email address before storing it to database to prevent further errors.
vulnerability_information:
From the page: **https://app.mavenlink.com/settings/email**
When I tried to update the email address, I noticed that the database field was allocating 255 characters there.And if the input was more than 255 character that field was truncating.
For example:
``` text
haxorsistz+axorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxoailrsistzhaxoaaaaaaaa@gmail.com
```
This is a **265** character address.Though as per  RFC the maximum length allowed for an email address is 255 characters.
But when I submitted that info,that was truncated and stored first 255 characters to the database.So the email address which was stored into database was:
```text
haxorsistz+axorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxorsistzhaxoailrsistzhaxoaaaaaaaa
```
Which is an invalid email address,without any @ and trailing domain name.

So,I suggest mavenlink to check the submitted character length and the validity of that email address before storing it to database to prevent further errors.

profile.about: Mavenlink provides sophisticated software and services to help organizations conduct business online, improve productivity, and grow profitably.
profile.name: Mavenlink
